definition: decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: He writes simply and succinctly, rarely adding too much adornment.
sentences.chinese: 樸實簡練，很少添加飾詞。

sentences.english: Only public and abstract modifiers are allowed for methods in interfaces.
sentences.chinese: 只有公開和抽象的修飾詞在方法中被允許。

sentences.english: For some, geographical modifiers are the key to traffic.
sentences.chinese: 對於有些網站，地理修飾詞是流量之關鍵。

sentences.english: Select a type and status, and indicate if it’s a modifier.
sentences.chinese: 選擇一個類型和狀態，並指定它是否是修飾詞。
